object-oriented.text: I am highly experienced with object-oriented programming, having taken multiple courses in C and C++. These courses have involved group projects in which I have taken the role of team lead and have also designed the structure of the entire multi-thousand line program.

front-end-web.text: I have considerable background in front-end web development having worked multiple jobs in the field using Javascript, CSS and HTML, as well as other technologies such as Typescript, Less, Sass, AngularJS, React and Electron. I also have experience building browser extensions for Google Chrome.

back-end-web.text: At past companies I've had extensive experience writing server-side code in both node.js and Ruby, using frameworks such as express.js, Rails and Sinatra. I've also written servers for personal projects, as well as configuring the DNS for them.

database.text: Past jobs have had me interacting greatly with the database, including many complex MySQL queries, optimizing table indices

aws.test: I have used Amazon Web Services in past co-op jobs, particularly EC2, ECS and IAM, though I'm also familiar with S3, RDS, SQS, Elastic Beanstalk,ElastiCache, Kinesis, OpsWorks and CloudWatch. I've been tasked with creating new staging instances, as well as first-time setup of new microservices.

operating-systems.text: At past companies I have developed on all of Windows, OS X and Unix/Linux environments and would consider myself comfortable coding on each of them. Through school I have learned Racket, a functional language based on Scheme, and Bash scripting, which I have also used in the workplace.

version-control.text: I have worked extensively with several version control softwares such as Git, Github and Mercurial in the contexts of university classes, independent projects and work environments. I have also researched into these technologies for past work term reports.

research-projects.text: At all my previous companies I have worked on research projects, quickly producing detailed proof-of-concepts for technologies such as Electron, Aurelia, Parsehub and the Google Web Speech API. At Flipp I researched a long-standing issue surrounding stale database locks and designed a solution to fix it.

scienctific-programming.text: This term I am taking Physics 239: Computational Physics. Using both C++ and Octave, a free version of Matlab, this course teaches an object‚Äêoriented approach to many phsyics problems, with more general methods taught as well, such as solving differential equations and Monte Carlo techniques.
